definition: to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Instead, the report says internal power struggles have left the government lacking cohesion.
sentences.chinese: 相反，報告說，內部權力鬥爭使得政府缺乏一致性。

sentences.english: No country is spared from power struggle which is part and parcel of politics.
sentences.chinese: 有政治就必然有權力鬥爭，任何國家都概莫能外。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
